title: Ketika Energi Hijau Terganjal Kebijakan, Masa Depan Biodiesel Dipertaruhkan - InfoSAWIT
description:
InfoSAWIT, KUALA LUMPUR — Industri biodiesel global tengah menghadapi turbulensi yang tidak hanya disebabkan oleh naiknya permintaan energi bersih, tetapi juga oleh serangkaian perubahan kebijakan strategis dari berbagai negara.
“Produksi biofuel global kini terganjal oleh menurunnya pengumpulan minyak bekas dan limbah, terutama sejak awal 2024,” ungkap Hammerschmidt.
Secara keseluruhan, kebutuhan diperkirakan melonjak hingga 8 juta ton dalam periode 2025–2026.
Wilayah ini menerapkan kebijakan ketat yang hanya mengizinkan penggunaan feedstock dari limbah dan bahan baku maju untuk SAF dan biodiesel sektor maritim.
Meski impor HVO dan SAF sempat menutupi penurunan volume biodiesel, kekhawatiran soal keberlanjutan pasokan tetap membayangi.
text:
InfoSAWIT, KUALA LUMPUR — Industri biodiesel global tengah menghadapi turbulensi yang tidak hanya disebabkan oleh naiknya permintaan energi bersih, tetapi juga oleh serangkaian perubahan kebijakan strategis dari berbagai negara. Dalam Konferensi The 36th Palm & Lauric Oils Price Outlook Conference & Exhibition (POC 2025) yang digelar Februari lalu di Kuala Lumpur, Head of Vegoils and Biofuels Research dari Ceras Analytics, Artem Hammerschmidt, mengungkapkan bahwa ketegangan utama datang dari dua arah: perlambatan pasokan bahan baku dan pilihan kebijakan yang belum tentu berpihak pada keberlanjutan industri.

“Produksi biofuel global kini terganjal oleh menurunnya pengumpulan minyak bekas dan limbah, terutama sejak awal 2024,” ungkap Hammerschmidt. Kondisi ini diprediksi memicu defisit bahan baku yang lebih besar pada 2025 dan 2026, mendorong industri untuk beralih ke minyak nabati sebagai substitusi.

Di sisi lain, target ambisius dekarbonisasi dari Eropa, Amerika Serikat, hingga Indonesia telah mengangkat permintaan untuk biodiesel, renewable diesel (HVO), dan sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). Secara keseluruhan, kebutuhan diperkirakan melonjak hingga 8 juta ton dalam periode 2025–2026.

BACA JUGA: Bupati Tulang Bawang Dukung Sinergi Petani Sawit untuk Kesejahteraan dan Keberlanjutan

Namun pertumbuhan ini menimbulkan pertanyaan besar, terutama di Eropa. Wilayah ini menerapkan kebijakan ketat yang hanya mengizinkan penggunaan feedstock dari limbah dan bahan baku maju untuk SAF dan biodiesel sektor maritim. Hal ini membuat Eropa sangat bergantung pada pasokan minyak limbah, yang jumlahnya semakin terbatas. Meski impor HVO dan SAF sempat menutupi penurunan volume biodiesel, kekhawatiran soal keberlanjutan pasokan tetap membayangi.

“Total kebutuhan bahan bakar bio untuk transportasi darat, udara, dan laut diperkirakan naik 2,5 juta ton tahun ini dan bertambah 1,3 juta ton lagi pada 2026,” papar Hammerschmidt.

Di Indonesia pun tidak luput dari tantangan. Pemerintah tengah dihadapkan pada kebutuhan untuk menambah produksi biodiesel sebesar 1,4 juta ton pada 2025, di tengah keterbatasan dana subsidi dari Badan Pengelola Dana Perkebunan (BPDP). Jika pemerintah memperluas subsidi ke sektor non-public service obligation (non-PSO), dana BPDPKS diprediksi akan habis pada akhir kuartal ketiga 2025.

BACA JUGA: Produktivitas Masih Rendah, GAPKI Dorong Akselerasi Transformasi Industri Sawit Nasional

Dalam situasi ini, muncul dua pilihan kebijakan: menaikkan penalti bagi perusahaan yang tidak mematuhi mandat biodiesel, atau meningkatkan pungutan ekspor sawit guna memperkuat pendanaan subsidi. Keduanya dinilai dapat membantu menjaga harga minyak sawit di pasar global tetap kompetitif.

Secara keseluruhan, kekurangan minyak bekas dan limbah mendorong lonjakan permintaan terhadap minyak nabati, termasuk minyak sawit, minyak kedelai, dan minyak biji rapa. “Dengan meningkatnya konsumsi, stok minyak nabati global diperkirakan akan terus menurun hingga akhir 2026,” kata Hammerschmidt. (T2)

Lebih lengkap Baca Majalah infoSAWIT Edisi April 2025

title: Most people don't see the extent of the work. And that's okay. We didn't… | Vinesh Sinha
description:
Most people don’t see the extent of the work.
And that’s okay.
Decarbonising the planet won’t happen overnight.
It won’t happen in headlines.
And it definitely won’t happen by accident.
text: Most people don’t see the extent of the work. And that’s okay. We didn’t come to be seen. We came to deliver. Decarbonising the planet won’t happen overnight. It won’t happen in headlines. And it definitely won’t happen by accident. It happens here—on the ground. Where waste is collected, data is traced, partnerships are built, and belief turns into infrastructure. We’ve chosen to focus on what matters most: Sustainable Aviation Fuel. Because aviation is still growing—and the world can’t wait. This isn’t a trend. It’s a mission. A quiet commitment to serve the planet, the people, and the generations yet to come.

title: Alemanha promete revolucionar a aviação com novo turboélice - DeFato Online
description:
A Deutsche Aircraft revelou o protótipo do D328eco, um turboélice regional projetado com foco em eficiência e sustentabilidade.
O evento ocorreu em Oberpfaffenhofen, Alemanha, sinalizando a intenção de atender às novas regras de emissões europeias.
Os motores compatíveis com SAF prometem significativa redução de emissões, contribuindo para os objetivos globais de descarbonização.
A expectativa é que o D328eco estabeleça novos padrões na aviação regional, aliando tecnologia de ponta a práticas sustentáveis.
Este modelo destaca a Alemanha como líder em inovação aeroespacial, respondendo a preocupações ambientais crescentes.
text:
A Deutsche Aircraft revelou o protótipo do D328eco, um turboélice regional projetado com foco em eficiência e sustentabilidade. O evento ocorreu em Oberpfaffenhofen, Alemanha, sinalizando a intenção de atender às novas regras de emissões europeias. A fuselagem é estendida para comportar 40 passageiros, adaptando-se aos requisitos modernos de eficiência ambiental.

O protótipo incorpora motores Pratt & Whitney Canada PW127XT-S, compatíveis com 100% de SAF (Sustainable Aviation Fuel), podendo reduzir as emissões de CO₂ em até 95%. A produção está programada para iniciar em 2025, com as operações comerciais previstas para 2027.

Parcerias internacionais estratégicas

O desenvolvimento do D328eco conta com contribuições significativas do Brasil. A Akaer, uma empresa de engenharia aeroespacial, fabricará partes críticas, reforçando a cooperação internacional. Essa colaboração não só promove o avanço tecnológico, mas também fortalece laços no setor aeroespacial global. O projeto integra avanços como sistemas de rádio de alta frequência da Honeywell, aprimorando as comunicações em voos de longa distância.

Com capacidade de operar em pistas curtas e sob condições climáticas adversas, o D328eco se destaca pela versatilidade. Estão previstas até 48 unidades por ano na linha de montagem em Leipzig/Halle. Os motores compatíveis com SAF prometem significativa redução de emissões, contribuindo para os objetivos globais de descarbonização. Tudo isso sem comprometer o desempenho, oferecendo uma alternativa mais ecológica às aeronaves atuais.

A expectativa é que o D328eco estabeleça novos padrões na aviação regional, aliando tecnologia de ponta a práticas sustentáveis. Este modelo destaca a Alemanha como líder em inovação aeroespacial, respondendo a preocupações ambientais crescentes. A combinação de sustentabilidade, inovação tecnológica e parcerias globais promete transformar o mercado regional até o final desta década, posicionando o D328eco como uma solução robusta e econômica para os desafios atuais da aviação.

title: United Airlines Orders 40 Airbus A321neos to Bolster Future Fleet - Travel Radar
description:
United Airlines have placed an order for 40 Airbus A231neo aircraft, previously listed as an unknown customer in Airbus’ orders and deliveries report.
New Aircraft United Airlines’ new order will secure deliveries post-2030 and, in bolstering their Airbus portfolio, reinforce their goals of modernisation and enhanced sustainability.
The Airbus A231neo, known for its extended range and high fuel efficiency, will help United also work towards its long term goals of reducing emissions whilst simultaneously meeting customer demand.
United currently already has 37 Airbus A321-200NX in its fleet, 35 being owned and 2 being leased, with another 165 set to be delivered in the future.
A little more about United Airlines
text:
United Airlines have placed an order for 40 Airbus A231neo aircraft, previously listed as an unknown customer in Airbus’ orders and deliveries report.

New Aircraft

United Airlines’ new order will secure deliveries post-2030 and, in bolstering their Airbus portfolio, reinforce their goals of modernisation and enhanced sustainability.

The Airbus A231neo, known for its extended range and high fuel efficiency, will help United also work towards its long term goals of reducing emissions whilst simultaneously meeting customer demand. With United’s roster being predominantly Boeing, a step towards diversifying their aircraft may be to help keep them operationally flexible, but the push towards Airbus could also be a response to certification delays with the Boeing 737 MAX 10 which, due to the delays, may not be ready for delivery until 2027 or 2028.

United currently already has 37 Airbus A321-200NX in its fleet, 35 being owned and 2 being leased, with another 165 set to be delivered in the future.

United’s Bright Future

Along with the bolstering of its fleet, United also announced on May 30th 2025 that they will see a record number of flights from Chicago and its hometown hub of O’Hare International Airport. This announcement also follows the confirmation of its extended weekend services to Latin and Caribbean destinations later this year to destinations like Cozumel, Saint Martin and Guatemala City.

Omar Idris, United’s Vice President of O’Hare said:

“Building on the momentum of an anticipated-record-breaking summer, we’re taking things further this fall with our busiest flight schedule of the year — adding more flights and extending service to warm-weather destinations in the U.S. and around the world”.

United’s efforts to modernise their fleet with customer satisfaction and sustainability in mind, paired with its record-breaking activity consolidate it as a leading airline on a global scale.

A little more about United Airlines

outlet: Ohio Ag Net | Ohio's Country Journal
title: Soy Check-off dollars at work and the importance of farmer involvement
description:
By Dusty Sonnenberg, CCA, Field Leader, a project of the Ohio Soybean Council and Soybean Check-off It all starts with farmers having a conversation.
“At the end of the day we are knocking on doors because of farmer investment.” The Soybean Check-off funds research, promotion and education initiatives.
Creating demand for soybeans is a function that aligns with all three of those.
Creating soybean demand comes in many forms.
“If we’re not going to export part of that 60% that is currently going out, what are we doing to drive domestic demand?” asked Lentsch.
text:
By Dusty Sonnenberg, CCA, Field Leader, a project of the Ohio Soybean Council and Soybean Check-off

It all starts with farmers having a conversation. Every relationship begins with two individuals communicating. It is actually that simple. Creating market demand for soybeans begins with two people talking about how to meet each other’s needs as one has a supply and the other a demand. When the supply and demand volumes get larger, the conversations grow as well. “For 35 years the United Soybean Board, funded by soybean farmers and their check-off, has been knocking on international doors, developing relationships, and driving innovation to ensure that there is opportunity for domestic demand as well as international,” said Lucas Lentsch, Chief Executive Officer of the United Soybean Board. “At the end of the day we are knocking on doors because of farmer investment.”

The Soybean Check-off funds research, promotion and education initiatives. Creating demand for soybeans is a function that aligns with all three of those. Creating soybean demand comes in many forms. “It is important to remember 60% of what we raise today is exported,” said Lentsch. “To give an example of how much we are really talking about, a great visual is 6 Panamax ships leaving the port every day filled with soybeans. You can also think of it as 45 truckloads of grain every minute that is being exported. That is the size and scale of a Panamax export vessel. A Panamax ship is just under 1000 feet long and a little over 100 feet wide. If you were to fill six of those a day, that’s essentially 45 trucks a minute to make that happen.” It is because of the importance of the volume of soybeans being exported, that farmers pay close attention when there are talks about global trade and tariffs.

Equally important is the creation and development of new domestic markets. “We are proud of the work that we have done to increase utilization domestically. We can talk about everything from soy firefighting foam that is safer for firefighters, to high oleic soybeans that have an extended shelf life for frying,” said Lentsch. “We also have discovered secondary benefits in roasted high oleic soybeans, through a farmer funded soy check-project, that is increasing the milk fat for dairy cattle when properly fed the soybean meal.”

While the Soybean Check-off does not get involved in policy directly, a lot of the work that is done goes into driving information and research that helps inform that policy making. “The biofuels conversation is alive and well,” said Lentsch. “You do not need to look any further than the opportunities in marine or rail. With the rail we have the six Class 1 carriers that are all committed to utilizing biofuels as they make pledges for 2025 and beyond. With sustainable aviation fuel we have an opportunity estimated at a little over 27 billion gallons, and as of today biofuels are only a little over 1% of that. There is huge upside potential. Unfortunately, a lot of what it is going to take to realize that potential has to do with things that are beyond our control.”

It is always important to keep in mind the bigger picture for perspectives on soybean usage. “If we’re not going to export part of that 60% that is currently going out, what are we doing to drive domestic demand?” asked Lentsch. “We know that between feed for animals, poultry and pigs are #1 and #2 customers, and between our oil utilization and the innovation in the pipeline of high oleic or other bio-based alternatives, soy oil is truly a drop-in replacement for petroleum. Simply stated, a petroleum use today is a is a soy oil replacement tomorrow, and that is a pretty positive spot for us as we look to the future.”

title: Sustainable Aviation Fuel can transform rural India in future: IATA Net Zero programs head
description:
The Head of Net Zero Research & Programs at IATA, Preeti Jain.
With 30% of the operational costs of most airlines going towards buying fuel, where does India, the third biggest aviation market globally, find itself on the SAF front?
India has the potential to produce around 40 million tonnes of SAF by 2050.
“It is time for India to rationalise its existing feedstocks for aviation, a hard-to-decarbonise sector, and catalyse the SAF story,” the IATA top official added.
Nearly 100 million tonnes of biomass would still be available in the Indian market for SAF after its use in other bio-energy sectors, she pointed out.
text:
The Head of Net Zero Research & Programs at IATA, Preeti Jain. NEW DELHI: The need for producing Sustainability Aviation Fuel (SAF) extensively to meet the airline industry’s goal of net zero emissions by 2050 came up for extensive discussions during the recent annual meet by the International Air Transport Association (IATA).

The Association also announced that it would soon launch the SAF Matchmaker, which will connect the eco-friendly fuel suppliers globally with the airlines in order to usher in transparency in the SAF market.

With 30% of the operational costs of most airlines going towards buying fuel, where does India, the third biggest aviation market globally, find itself on the SAF front?

The Head of Net Zero Research & Programs at IATA, Preeti Jain, told this reporter, “The Jet fuel demand consumption in the world annually is 300 million tonnes but only one million tonnes of SAF have been produced globally last year and this throws open a massive opportunity. India has the potential to produce around 40 million tonnes of SAF by 2050. This is a real economic opportunity for rural Indian transformation and to fuel sustainable aviation growth and it must not be missed.”

Energy companies in India are looking at co-processing and investing in Ethanol-to-Jet plants to produce SAF. “There needs to be feedstock prioritisation and the government needs to start providing capital support without any delay in SAF plants,” she urged. India could position itself as a leading regional SAF hub in future. It would roughly cost 100 to 150 million US dollars to install one such plant.

“India’s leadership in biofuels is exemplary, with policy support making it the world’s third-largest producer of ethanol,” Jain elaborated. Continued policy momentum is crucial to channelising the country’s biomass and waste resources and adopting new technologies through incentives and research-focused grants, she added.

India is one of the feedstock hotspots in the world with 10% of global biomass feedstock available for SAF. “It is time for India to rationalise its existing feedstocks for aviation, a hard-to-decarbonise sector, and catalyse the SAF story,” the IATA top official added.

Nearly 100 million tonnes of biomass would still be available in the Indian market for SAF after its use in other bio-energy sectors, she pointed out.

title: Vietnam Airlines, China Southern sign landmark JV - Travel Mole
description:
The first joint venture between Vietnamese and Chinese airlines has been announced.
The pact between Vietnam Airlines and China Southern Airlines aims to boost air connectivity and efficiency.
The airlines will start coordinating flights schedules, jointly operate on selected routes, and offer interline services for onward travel.
Loyalty members of both carriers will also receive added perks like priority check-in, priority boarding and an extra baggage allowance.
Combined, the airlines operate more than 160 weekly flights between the two countries.
text:
The first joint venture between Vietnamese and Chinese airlines has been announced.

The pact between Vietnam Airlines and China Southern Airlines aims to boost air connectivity and efficiency.

The airlines will start coordinating flights schedules, jointly operate on selected routes, and offer interline services for onward travel.

Loyalty members of both carriers will also receive added perks like priority check-in, priority boarding and an extra baggage allowance.

Combined, the airlines operate more than 160 weekly flights between the two countries.

They began partnering 15 years ago through a codeshare agreement and expanded this a few years ago to encompass technical support and ground services.

title: Former Devon seaside town pub occupying substantial 19th-century property up for auction
description:
A historic former pub in a Devon seaside town will be going under the hammer at its upcoming auction later this month.
The substantial 19th-century property has a guide price of £975,000.
Savills Auction has brought the property to market on behalf of a private client.
Steven Cane, Savills Auctions, said: "The sale of the Inn on the Green presents a rare and exciting opportunity to acquire a substantial property in the sought-after seaside town of Paignton, Devon.
Offered with vacant possession, the property provides significant potential for development or asset management, subject to the necessary consents.
text:
A historic former pub in a Devon seaside town will be going under the hammer at its upcoming auction later this month. The substantial 19th-century property has a guide price of £975,000.

The Inn on the Green occupies a prominent position in Paignton, with the building extending to more than 27,300 sq ft and including a large adjoining car park.

The site, now vacant represents a significant redevelopment opportunity in a sought-after coastal location.

Located just a short walk from Paignton Pier and beach, the Inn on the Green enjoys uninterrupted sea views and easy access to the town centre’s amenities and attractions.

While the site is offered without planning consent, a previous application for conversion into a public car park was submitted but later withdrawn earlier this year.

Savills Auction has brought the property to market on behalf of a private client.

Steven Cane, Savills Auctions, said: "The sale of the Inn on the Green presents a rare and exciting opportunity to acquire a substantial property in the sought-after seaside town of Paignton, Devon. Positioned on the coast of Tor Bay, this former hotel enjoys a prominent location with uninterrupted sea views, just a short walk from the pier and beach.

"We’re pleased to bring the hotel to market at our auction on June 17th. Offered with vacant possession, the property provides significant potential for development or asset management, subject to the necessary consents. And with a guide price that represents excellent value, we anticipate strong interest."

title: Canada Meets the Heart of Europe: Air Canada Launches Direct Flights from Toronto to Prague
description:
In a milestone expansion of its transatlantic network, Air Canada has officially inaugurated its newest European route with a direct flight from Toronto to Prague, Czech Republic.
Whether for leisure, business, or family travel, the Toronto–Prague route brings two vibrant destinations closer than ever before.
Elevated Travel Experiences with Air Canada Signature Service Air Canada continues to enhance its global image with award-winning service offerings.
Commitment to Sustainable Aviation In line with its 2050 net-zero emissions goal, Air Canada emphasizes environmental responsibility.
Booking and Loyalty Benefits Through Aeroplan Air Canada’s loyalty program, Aeroplan, continues to stand out in the North American airline market.
text:
In a milestone expansion of its transatlantic network, Air Canada has officially inaugurated its newest European route with a direct flight from Toronto to Prague, Czech Republic. Departing from Toronto Pearson International Airport on the evening of June 6, 2025, and arriving in Prague the following day, the launch marks an exciting chapter in international connectivity between North America and Central Europe.

This new seasonal service, running through September 29, 2025, comes as part of Air Canada’s strategic plan to strengthen its European network while offering travelers more choice, convenience, and cultural access. Whether for leisure, business, or family travel, the Toronto–Prague route brings two vibrant destinations closer than ever before.

According to Mark Galardo, Executive Vice President & Chief Commercial Officer and President, Cargo at Air Canada, this new route is designed to appeal to a broad spectrum of travelers across the airline’s North American network, including those eager to explore Prague’s celebrated architecture, bohemian heritage, and UNESCO-listed old town, or for European travelers interested in discovering Canada’s rich natural and urban diversity.

A Gateway to One of Europe’s Most Enchanting Cities

Prague, the Czech capital, is famed for its medieval charm, cobblestone streets, and cultural landmarks like Prague Castle, the Astronomical Clock, Charles Bridge, and St. Vitus Cathedral. With this direct route, Canadian travelers can now reach one of Europe’s most visually stunning and historically significant cities without the hassle of layovers.

Simultaneously, Czech tourists can experience Canada’s renowned diversity, from the cosmopolitan energy of Toronto to the breathtaking wilderness of Banff, Vancouver, and the Rockies.

Air Canada’s European Expansion: A Summer of Strategic Routes

The Toronto–Prague flight is part of a broader summer expansion that includes several new and returning routes across Europe:

Montreal to Porto, inaugurated earlier this week

Toronto to Naples, launched in May 2025

Ottawa to London Heathrow, relaunched in April

Upcoming Montreal to Edinburgh route beginning at the end of June

These new connections reflect Air Canada’s effort to deepen international engagement, improve trade relations, and offer more robust tourism flows between Canada and Europe.

Flight Schedule and Aircraft Details

The new Prague route operates on the Airbus A330-300, a wide-body aircraft known for its fuel efficiency and passenger comfort. The aircraft features:

Three cabin classes:

Air Canada Signature Class: Lie-flat seats, gourmet dining, and priority airport services

Premium Economy: Extra legroom, premium meals, and additional baggage allowance

Economy Class: Comfortable seating and full in-flight service

Flight AC934 departs Toronto at 21:40 on Tuesdays, Fridays, and Sundays, arriving in Prague at 12:10 the following day.

Flight AC935 returns from Prague at 13:40 on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays, arriving in Toronto at 16:50 the same day.

This schedule runs from June 6 to September 29, 2025.

Elevated Travel Experiences with Air Canada Signature Service

Air Canada continues to enhance its global image with award-winning service offerings. On the Toronto–Prague route, travelers can enjoy:

Air Canada Signature Class with lie-flat seats, priority boarding, and luxury meals crafted by top chefs

Maple Leaf Lounge access at major international hubs for eligible passengers

Aeroplan rewards, allowing passengers to earn and redeem points on flights, upgrades, hotels, car rentals, and more

In-flight entertainment, Wi-Fi, and multilingual service staff

These elevated services cater to both business and leisure travelers looking for comfort, connectivity, and exceptional service.

Why Prague? Strategic Benefits of the New Route

The selection of Prague as a new destination underlines Air Canada’s focus on connecting high-demand leisure and cultural cities. This route strengthens bilateral opportunities in several key areas:

Tourism: Prague continues to be one of the most visited cities in Europe, with over 8 million tourists annually. Canadians now have seamless access to this cultural gem.

Trade & Business: Improved air links foster greater business travel and potential for trade partnerships between Canadian and Czech companies.

Diaspora Travel: With a notable Czech diaspora in Canada, this route also supports VFR (visiting friends and relatives) travel.

Air Canada is also responding to growing demand from European tourists, many of whom seek adventure, natural beauty, and cultural variety in Canada.

Commitment to Sustainable Aviation

In line with its 2050 net-zero emissions goal, Air Canada emphasizes environmental responsibility. The Airbus A330-300 fleet is optimized for fuel efficiency, and the airline is investing in sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) and fleet modernization.

This commitment supports both environmental stewardship and long-term operational efficiency, aligning with international aviation sustainability goals.

Booking and Loyalty Benefits Through Aeroplan

Air Canada’s loyalty program, Aeroplan, continues to stand out in the North American airline market. With this new route, members can:

Redeem points for flights to Prague and other European destinations

Use Points + Cash combinations for greater booking flexibility

Earn on flights, partner airlines, car rentals, and hotels

Access exclusive deals and bonus offers

As a member of the Star Alliance, Air Canada also provides easy connection to 45+ global airlines, enabling smooth multi-city European itineraries.

How to Book

Travelers can book flights directly via website or through the Air Canada app, travel agencies, and GDS platforms. Early booking is recommended due to limited seasonal availability and strong demand for summer travel.

Air Canada’s media center also provides visuals, updates, and route guides for agents, partners, and media outlets.

What This Means for Canadian and European Travel in 2025

This new Toronto–Prague flight is more than a convenience—it’s a gateway to culture, heritage, and opportunity. As travel rebounds across continents, airlines are investing in experiences that bring travelers closer to iconic destinations while supporting tourism recovery and international connectivity.

With its reputation for service excellence, broad international reach, and strong focus on sustainability, Air Canada’s Prague route stands out as a valuable addition to the 2025 transatlantic travel landscape.

description:

Tin liên quan Lịch sự kiện Dự kiến sự kiện kinh tế từ ngày 3/6-9/6 06:29' - 03/06/2025 Ngày 3/6: EVN ký kết hợp đồng xây lắp dự án thủy điện Trị An mở rộng; Hàn Quốc - Bầu cử Tổng thống Hàn Quốc Kinh tế Việt Nam Sự kiện kinh tế Việt Nam nổi bật tuần qua 10:30' - 01/06/2025 Ngân hàng Nhà nước kết luận thanh tra tại loạt doanh nghiệp vàng, Vietjet mua 20 máy bay A330neo; Hòa Phát ký hợp đồng container “Made in Vietnam”... là các sự kiện kinh tế nổi bật tuần qua.
Tin cùng chuyên mục Kinh tế Việt Nam Thủ tướng Phạm Minh Chính dự Diễn đàn Tài chính và Kinh tế Xanh tại Monaco 18:10' Thủ tướng Chính phủ Phạm Minh Chính cùng Đoàn đại biểu cấp cao Việt Nam đã tham dự Diễn đàn Kinh tế và Tài chính xanh tại Công quốc Monaco.
Kinh tế Việt Nam Xem xét tăng các chuyến bay đêm từ Hà Nội, Tp.
text:
Trang chủ

Thời sự

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Sự kiện kinh tế Việt Nam nổi bật tuần qua

Theo vnanet.vn 09:37' - 08/06/2025 Theo dõi Bnews.vn trên News

Your browser does not support the audio element.

BNEWS Bnews/vnanet.vn, điểm lại các sự kiện kinh tế của Việt Nam nổi bật tuần qua.

1. VinSpeed và Thaco sớm hoàn thiện hồ sơ đề nghị chấp thuận chủ trương đầu tư đường sắt tốc độ cao Bắc - Nam. Bộ trưởng Bộ Xây dựng yêu cầu hai doanh nghiệp rà soát, hoàn thiện hồ sơ theo quy định tại Điều 33 Luật Đầu tư. Các doanh nghiệp này cũng hoàn thiện hồ sơ và gửi Bộ Tài chính, các bộ ngành để triển khai các thủ tục chấp thuận chủ trương đầu tư theo quy định tại Điều 34 Luật Đầu tư. 2. Bình Định chính thức cấp giấy chứng nhận đầu tư cho dự án Tổ hợp sản xuất tái chế vải Polyeste có tổng vốn đầu tư khoảng 1 tỷ USD của nhà đầu tư Tập đoàn SYRE IMPACT AB (Thụy Điển). Dự án dự kiến đi vào vận hành vào năm 2029 với quy mô sản xuất hạt nhựa PET công suất 100.000 - 250.000 m3 tấn sản phẩm/năm, tại khu công nghiệp Nhơn Hội (khu A) trên tổng diện tích gần 29ha. 3. 9 ngân hàng thương mại cho vay lãi suất thấp hơn 2% đối với người trẻ dưới 35 tuổi mua nhà ở xã hội. Đó là ngân hàng thương mại gồm: Agribank, VietinBank, Vietcombank, BIDV, HDBank, VPBank, Techcombank, TPBank và MB. Cụ thể, trong 5 năm đầu vay vốn kể từ ngày giải ngân đầu tiên, lãi suất cho vay được áp dụng thấp hơn 2% so với lãi suất cho vay trung và dài hạn bình quân bằng VND của 4 ngân hàng thương mại nhà nước. Mức lãi suất ưu đãi áp dụng đến hết ngày 30/6/2025 là 6,1%/năm. Trong 10 năm tiếp theo, người vay sẽ được hưởng mức lãi suất thấp hơn 1% so với lãi suất cho vay trung và dài hạn bình quân của 4 ngân hàng thương mại nhà nước nói trên. 4. Công ty cổ phần Lọc Hóa dầu Bình Sơn (BSR) đã ra mắt và xuất bán thành công lô sản phẩm thương mại đầu tiên nhiên liệu hàng không bền vững (SAF - Sustainable Aviation Fuel). Lô sản phẩm SAF đầu tiên được sản xuất từ nguyên liệu nhập khẩu từ châu Âu và xăng máy bay (Jet A-1) sản xuất trong nước của BSR. Đối tác thương mại đầu tiên tiếp nhận sản phẩm là Công ty TNHH MTV Nhiên liệu Hàng không Việt Nam (Skypec) để cấp cho các chuyến bay của Vietnam Airlines. 5. Liên danh Tổng thầu EPC Samsung C&T và Tổng công ty Lắp máy Việt Nam (LILAMA) đã tiến hành đốt lửa lần đầu thành công Nhà máy điện Nhơn Trạch 4 (huyện Nhơn Trạch, tỉnh Đồng Nai) vào ngày 6/6. Đây cũng là cơ sở để hoàn thành các mốc quan trọng tiếp theo như: hòa đồng bộ và bàn giao Nhà máy điện Nhơn Trạch 4 phát điện thương mại vào tháng 12/2025. 6. UBND tỉnh Lâm Đồng phê duyệt Dự án xây dựng đường bộ cao tốc Tân Phú (tỉnh Đồng Nai) – Bảo Lộc (tỉnh Lâm Đồng) theo phương thức đối tác công tư. Dự án có tổng chiều dài 65,88km, trong đó đoạn đi qua địa bàn tỉnh Đồng Nai dài 11,91km, qua địa bàn tỉnh Lâm Đồng 53,97km. Dự án dự kiến đưa vào khai thác quý IV năm 2027. Tổng mức đầu tư 18.002 tỷ đồng, trong đó vốn nhà nước 6.500 tỷ đồng (ngân sách Trung ương 2.000 tỷ đồng, ngân sách địa phương 4.500 tỷ đồng), vốn thực hiện của nhà đầu tư 11.502 tỷ đồng. 7. Lô "Gạo Việt xanh phát thải thấp" đầu tiên được xuất khẩu sang Nhật Bản. Lễ xuất khẩu lô hàng 500 tấn gạo mang nhãn hiệu “Gạo Việt xanh phát thải thấp” đầu tiên sang Nhật Bản được Hiệp hội Ngành hàng lúa gạo Việt Nam (Vietrisa) phối hợp với Công ty cổ phần Nông nghiệp công nghệ cao Trung An (Công ty Trung An), Cần Thơ tổ chức vào chiều 5/6. Đây là sự kiện đánh dấu sản phẩm gạo từ Đề án 1 triệu ha lúa mang nhãn hiệu “Gạo Việt xanh phát thải thấp” được xuất khẩu ra thị trường nước ngoài. 8. Vietnam Airlines tăng tần suất bay từ TP. Hồ Chí Minh đến Singapore và Bangkok dịp cao điểm Hè. Với đường bay TP. Hồ Chí Minh - Singapore, Vietnam Airlines sẽ bổ sung thêm 1 chuyến bay vào các ngày thứ Hai, Tư, Sáu và Bảy trong giai đoạn từ ngày 2/6 đến 25/10/2025, nâng tổng số chuyến trên đường bay này lên 18 chuyến/tuần. Với đường bay TP. Hồ Chí Minh - Bangkok, Vietnam Airlines cũng tăng thêm 1 chuyến bay mỗi ngày trong giai đoạn từ ngày 18/8 đến 25/10/2025, nâng tần suất khai thác trên đường bay này lên 5 chuyến/ngày. 9. Tập đoàn Điện lực Việt Nam (EVN) áp dụng mẫu hóa đơn tiền điện mới từ 1/6. Mẫu hóa đơn mới được điều chỉnh, bổ sung một số thông tin gồm: Số định danh; mã số đơn vị có quan hệ với ngân sách; số hộ chiếu. Trường hợp khách hàng đã cung cấp thông tin trên cho đơn vị điện lực (khi thực hiện ký hợp đồng hoặc thay đổi thông tin hợp đồng, cập nhật bổ sung thông tin), trên hoá đơn tiền điện sẽ hiển thị các thông tin theo quy định. 10. Hãng hàng không Emirates chính thức khai thác đường bay đầu tiên từ Dubai - Đà Nẵng (quá cảnh qua Băng Cốc), với tần suất 4 chuyến mỗi tuần, vào các ngày thứ Hai, thứ Tư, thứ Sáu và Chủ nhật. Đà Nẵng là điểm đến thứ ba tại Việt Nam sau TP. Hồ Chí Minh và Hà Nội trong mạng lưới bay toàn cầu của Hãng. Emirates là hãng hàng không lớn và quy mô nhất tại khu vực Trung Đông với tiềm năng khai thác lớn, lên đến 4.100 chuyến bay/tuần từ Sân bay Quốc tế Dubai di chuyển đến 140 thành phố ở hơn 80 quốc gia trên khắp thế giới.

Tin liên quan

Lịch sự kiện

Dự kiến sự kiện kinh tế từ ngày 3/6-9/6

06:29' - 03/06/2025

Ngày 3/6: EVN ký kết hợp đồng xây lắp dự án thủy điện Trị An mở rộng; Hàn Quốc - Bầu cử Tổng thống Hàn Quốc

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Sự kiện kinh tế Việt Nam nổi bật tuần qua

10:30' - 01/06/2025

Ngân hàng Nhà nước kết luận thanh tra tại loạt doanh nghiệp vàng, Vietjet mua 20 máy bay A330neo; Hòa Phát ký hợp đồng container “Made in Vietnam”... là các sự kiện kinh tế nổi bật tuần qua.

Ngân hàng

KienlongBank ghi dấu ấn với Giao dịch viên AI tại sự kiện chuyển đổi số ngành ngân hàng 2025

11:16' - 31/05/2025

KienlongBank đã ghi dấu tại ngày chuyển đổi số ngành ngân hàng 2025 với Giao dịch viên AI độc đáo, mang đến các dịch vụ tài chính chuyên sâu, chuyên biệt, cá nhân hóa theo từng khách hàng.

Tin cùng chuyên mục

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Thủ tướng Phạm Minh Chính dự Diễn đàn Tài chính và Kinh tế Xanh tại Monaco

18:10'

Thủ tướng Chính phủ Phạm Minh Chính cùng Đoàn đại biểu cấp cao Việt Nam đã tham dự Diễn đàn Kinh tế và Tài chính xanh tại Công quốc Monaco.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Bộ Xây dựng cho ý kiến về đề xuất đầu tư mở rộng sân bay Phú Quốc của IPP Group, Sun Group

15:51'

Ngày 1/6/2025, Chính phủ đã ban hành Nghị quyết số 01/2025/NQ-CP về đầu tư mở rộng Cảng hàng không quốc tế Phú Quốc.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Ngành chế biến, chế tạo tăng hơn 10%, động lực chính cho toàn ngành công nghiệp

15:19'

Cục Thống kê, Bộ Tài chính cho biết, chỉ số sản xuất toàn ngành công nghiệp (IIP) tháng 5/2025 ước tính tăng 4,3% so với tháng trước và tăng 9,4% so với cùng kỳ năm trước.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Xem xét tăng các chuyến bay đêm từ Hà Nội, Tp. Hồ Chí Minh đến Bình Định và ngược lại

14:45'

Cục Hàng không Việt Nam vừa có văn bản về việc tăng cường thêm các chuyến bay đêm từ Hà Nội, Tp.Hồ Chí Minh đến tỉnh Bình Định và ngược lại.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Nhu cầu tiêu dùng và du lịch cao kéo tổng mức bán lẻ hàng hóa tăng 10,2%

13:56'

Cục Thống kê, Bộ Tài chính mới công bố, tổng mức bán lẻ hàng hóa và doanh thu dịch vụ tiêu dùng tháng 5/2025 ước tăng 10,2% so với cùng kỳ năm trước.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Hoàn thiện các Nghị định phân cấp, phân quyền trước ngày 10/6/2025

10:46'

Thủ tướng vừa ban hành Công điện số 83/CĐ-TTg ngày 7/6/2025 của Thủ tướng Chính phủ về việc tiếp tục đẩy mạnh phân cấp, phân quyền; phân định thẩm quyền trong các ngành, lĩnh vực.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Thủ tướng Phạm Minh Chính thăm gia đình người Việt Nam tại Pháp

08:39'

Chiều 7/6 (giờ địa phương), Thủ tướng Chính phủ Phạm Minh Chính và Phu nhân đã tới thăm gia đình anh Võ Bá Luận – chủ nhà hàng ở thành phố Nice.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Thủ tướng: Văn hóa là sợi dây đầy âm thanh và sắc màu cho tình hữu nghị Việt Nam - Pháp

08:15'

Chiều 7/6, Thủ tướng Chính phủ Phạm Minh Chính và Phu nhân đã thăm phố cổ và các công trình văn hóa ở Nice.

Kinh tế Việt Nam

Hiệp định EVFTA - định hướng hợp tác chiến lược trong giai đoạn mới

22:29' - 07/06/2025

Cơ cấu kinh tế của Việt Nam và EU mang tính bổ trợ lẫn nhau thay vì cạnh tranh, giúp mở rộng dư địa hợp tác, đặc biệt trong bối cảnh toàn cầu đang cần đa dạng hóa chuỗi cung ứng.

title: SAF procurement and commercialization strategies | Dieter Billen - LinkedIn
description:
With Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) prices typically two to three times higher than traditional jet fuel, airlines are grappling with the dual challenge of reducing their environmental impact while maintaining economic viability.
The additional cost of SAF can be partially offset by additional revenue related to SAF products, with specific offerings linked to unique motivations and willingness-to-pay of different customer segments.
This involves creating tailored solutions for cargo customers, corporate clients and leisure customers.
This is especially true in Asia, which accounts for around one third of global aviation demand (and more than 50% of global growth), limited SAF mandates at this stage and very differentiated willingness-to-pay for SAF and sustainability.
Read our article on combining SAF procurement with commercialization strategies here: https://lnkd.in/gMiXUT2a #SAF Nikhil Sachdeva Diego Ibarra Yvonne Ruf Florian Dehne Dustin Herr Thor Kristjansson
text: With Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) prices typically two to three times higher than traditional jet fuel, airlines are grappling with the dual challenge of reducing their environmental impact while maintaining economic viability. The additional cost of SAF can be partially offset by additional revenue related to SAF products, with specific offerings linked to unique motivations and willingness-to-pay of different customer segments. This involves creating tailored solutions for cargo customers, corporate clients and leisure customers. This is especially true in Asia, which accounts for around one third of global aviation demand (and more than 50% of global growth), limited SAF mandates at this stage and very differentiated willingness-to-pay for SAF and sustainability. Read our article on combining SAF procurement with commercialization strategies here: https://lnkd.in/gMiXUT2a #SAF Nikhil Sachdeva Diego Ibarra Yvonne Ruf Florian Dehne Dustin Herr Thor Kristjansson

title: Hadirkan Program UCollect & RVM, Pertamina Ajak Warga Semarang Kelola Limbah Lewat ...
description:
Kabar BUMN - Dalam semangat memperingati Hari Lingkungan Hidup Sedunia, Pertamina Patra Niaga mengajak masyarakat kota Semarang mengelola limbah rumah tangga menjadi sesuatu yang bermanfaat.
Yaitu, UCollect (pengumpulan minyak jelantah) dan Reverse Vending Machine (RVM) (penukaran botol plastik), dihadirkan di SPBU 41.502.02, Jalan Sisingamangaraja, Semarang.
Melalui program UCollect dan RVM, kami ingin SPBU menjadi tempat masyarakat bisa berkontribusi dan menjadi bagian dari gerakan peduli lingkungan,” ujar Ega.
Pertamina juga menambahkan reward khusus berupa e-voucher MyPertamina yang bisa digunakan untuk pembelian BBM maupun produk lainnya di SPBU Pertamina ataupun saldo e-wallet.
Menurutnya, Pertamina Patra Niaga ingin momen Hari Lingkungan Hidup ini menjadi ajakan terbuka bagi semua pihak, bahwa menjaga bumi bisa dimulai dari rumah, dari dapur, dari botol yang dibuang.
text:
Kabar BUMN - Dalam semangat memperingati Hari Lingkungan Hidup Sedunia, Pertamina Patra Niaga mengajak masyarakat kota Semarang mengelola limbah rumah tangga menjadi sesuatu yang bermanfaat.

Ajakan pengelolaan limbah rumah tangga yang dilakukan bersamaan dengan peluncuran perdana produk Pertamax Green 95 di kota Semarang tersebut diwujudkan melalui dua program kampanye peduli lingkungan.

Yaitu, UCollect (pengumpulan minyak jelantah) dan Reverse Vending Machine (RVM) (penukaran botol plastik), dihadirkan di SPBU 41.502.02, Jalan Sisingamangaraja, Semarang.

Baca Juga: Pertamina Drilling Distribusikan 16 Hewan Kurban untuk Rayakan Idul Adha 1446 H

Plt. Direktur Utama Pertamina Patra Niaga, Mars Ega Legowo Putra, menyampaikan, program ini bukan hanya soal pengumpulan limbah, tapi juga tentang membangun kesadaran bersama akan pentingnya peran kecil setiap individu dalam merawat lingkungan.

“Kami percaya, perubahan besar bisa dimulai dari langkah kecil. Melalui program UCollect dan RVM, kami ingin SPBU menjadi tempat masyarakat bisa berkontribusi dan menjadi bagian dari gerakan peduli lingkungan,” ujar Ega.

Melalui Program UCOllect, masyarakat dapat menyetor minyak jelantah dari rumah ke kotak UCOllect yang tersedia.

Baca Juga: Patra Drilling Contractor Hadir untuk Sesama, Qurban Serentak di Seluruh Wilayah Operasional

Sedangkan RVM, masyarakat cukup memasukkan botol plastik bekas ke dalam mesin yang telah disediakan.

Setiap partisipasi dari masing-masing program tersebut, masyarakat akan memperoleh reward berupa poin, ewallet, dan semacamnya.

Pertamina juga menambahkan reward khusus berupa e-voucher MyPertamina yang bisa digunakan untuk pembelian BBM maupun produk lainnya di SPBU Pertamina ataupun saldo e-wallet.

Baca Juga: Pertamina Pastikan Pasokan Energi Aman dan Salurkan Ribuan Hewan Kurban Saat Iduladha 1446 H

Ega menambahkan program UCollect sendiri telah berjalan sejak Desember 2024 dan menjadi bagian dari inisiatif pengelolaan minyak jelantah menjadi energi terbarukan seperti Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) dan Hydrotreated Vegetable Oil (HVO).

Menurutnya, Pertamina Patra Niaga ingin momen Hari Lingkungan Hidup ini menjadi ajakan terbuka bagi semua pihak, bahwa menjaga bumi bisa dimulai dari rumah, dari dapur, dari botol yang dibuang.

title: Nigeria, Angola lead Africa's push for energy independence — Report - Punch Newspapers
description:
Nigeria and Angola are poised to spearhead Africa’s push for energy independence as the continent’s refining capacity is projected to climb to 90 per cent, up from just 45 per cent last year.
A new report by the Africa Finance Corporation titled “State of Africa’s Infrastructure Report 2025,” which was obtained by Sunday PUNCH stated this.
It said, “In 2023, 55 per cent of Africa’s demand for petroleum products was met by imports.
As new energy infrastructure is built, it must also be resilient and capable of supporting future energy transitions.
With the right policy frameworks and blended finance models, Africa’s refinery network can be transformed into a critical foundation of the continent’s future energy resilience.
text:
Nigeria and Angola are poised to spearhead Africa’s push for energy independence as the continent’s refining capacity is projected to climb to 90 per cent, up from just 45 per cent last year.

A new report by the Africa Finance Corporation titled “State of Africa’s Infrastructure Report 2025,” which was obtained by Sunday PUNCH stated this.

The report highlighted the shifting landscape in Africa’s energy sector driven by a wave of refinery investments, with Nigeria at the forefront, aided by the 650,000 barrels-per-day Dangote Refinery and the planned revival of state-owned facilities.

According to the AFC, Africa is edging towards self-sufficiency in petroleum products, stating that transportation, storage and distribution infrastructure must be upgraded to ensure fuel security.

If fully utilised, the report said refining capacity could meet up to 90 per cent of the continent’s fuel demand, compared to just 45 per cent last year.

The report revealed that over $16bn was needed for brownfield upgrades, modernising existing refineries to meet clean fuel standards and reduce reliance on imported fuels.

Simultaneously, greenfield investments, particularly in Nigeria and Angola, are critical for meeting future demand.

“First, brownfield upgrades: over $16 billion is needed to modernise existing refineries, meet clean fuel standards, and reduce reliance on imports. Second, greenfield investment is key to meeting future demand, with Nigeria and Angola emerging as new continental hubs,” the AFC stated.

It added that the two oil-rich nations were strategically positioned to anchor the continent’s refining resurgence.

Currently, Africa remains heavily dependent on fuel imports.

In 2023, 55 per cent of petroleum product demand was met through imports.

But the AFC believes this could fall drastically to 10 per cent, if existing and new refining capacity are optimised.

The report noted that the commissioning of Nigeria’s Dangote Refinery, alongside the phased reopening of the Port Harcourt and Warri refineries between 2024 and 2026, could significantly transform fuel security in the short term.

It said, “In 2023, 55 per cent of Africa’s demand for petroleum products was met by imports. However, if refining capacity were fully utilised, this number could drop to only 10 per cent.

“In that regard, the commissioning of the Dangote Refinery, along with the gradual re-opening of the Port Harcourt and Warri Refineries in Nigeria (2024-2026) could significantly transform the continent’s fuel security landscape in the short term.”

Still, the AFC cautioned that the Dangote Refinery alone will not be sufficient to meet Africa’s growing fuel demand, especially in light of prolonged refinery shutdowns in Libya and South Africa, as well as frequent disruptions in Egypt.

“More capacity addition is needed,” the report warned, calling for urgent attention to feedstock access, distribution infrastructure, and financing bottlenecks that currently hamper the sector,” he stated.

While Nigeria is Africa’s largest oil producer, the country has paradoxically been unable to consistently supply crude oil to its domestic refineries due to entrenched export contracts and limited local allocation.

The AFC further stated “the sector’s growth is closely tied to the modernisation of existing refineries in West and Central Africa, overcoming feedstock and financing challenges for new projects, and addressing critical infrastructure bottlenecks in transportation and distribution networks.

“To achieve fuel security and meet the continent’s increasing demand, Africa must prioritise investment in refinery upgrades, develop efficient distribution systems—including pipelines, railways, and diversified port infrastructure. As new energy infrastructure is built, it must also be resilient and capable of supporting future energy transitions. The successful integration of these elements will be crucial for achieving long-term fuel security and energy independence across the continent.

“Across West and Southern Africa in particular, a new wave of refinery investment can unlock efficiency, reduce fuel import bills, and enable countries to meet growing demand through cleaner, domestic production. With the right policy frameworks and blended finance models, Africa’s refinery network can be transformed into a critical foundation of the continent’s future energy resilience.

“Access to crude oil feedstock is another challenge that must be overcome, both for

producing and non-producing oil markets. Oil-producing companies mostly sell crude oil on the export market via long-term contracts and allocations with traders or financiers, leaving little space for the domestic supply. Nigeria, Africa’s largest oil producer, is a good example given that it supplies crude oil to Côte d’Ivoire and Senegal’s refineries yet does not have enough oil to feed its facilities,” the AFC stated.

Beyond refining, the report stressed that transporting fuel by road was no longer sustainable, revealing that 83 per cent of petroleum products in Africa were moved by trucks, leading to congestion, higher costs, and logistical inefficiencies.

It called for a transition to railways and pipelines to ease fuel logistics.

Despite the cost-effectiveness of rail transport for bulk liquids, many existing railway-connected depots, especially in Cameroon, Angola, South Africa, and the DRC, require urgent rehabilitation and modernisation.

It also recommended designing multi-fuel adaptable pipelines that can support the future transport of sustainable aviation fuel, LPG, and hydrogen, thereby enhancing long-term infrastructure viability and attracting capital investment.

It noted, “Similarly, pipeline projects should be conceptualised by considering future reconversion opportunities to transport transitional fuels like sustainable aviation fuels, liquefied petroleum gas and hydrogen. By designing pipelines with multi-fuel adaptability and integration into broader logistics networks, developers can enhance project viability, attract long-term capital, and safeguard infrastructure against future market shifts.

“To be efficient and cheaper, fuel logistics must also move away from roads.

An assessment by CITAC and Puma Energy found that 83 per cent of oil products distributed in Africa were transported by trucks, leading to congestion and capacity constraints, given additional roads, loading and evacuation requirements.

This overreliance on trucking can be addressed with more efficient solutions like railways or pipelines, where feasible.

“Despite its cost-effectiveness and suitability for bulk liquid transport, the use of rail for petroleum products remains limited across Africa. Several markets—including Cameroon, Angola, the DRC, and South Africa—already have fuel depots and storage tanks connected to railway lines. However, several of these are state-owned assets in need of rehabilitation, asset integrity upgrades, and operational modernisation. In many cases, deteriorated rail infrastructure is the limiting factor. Yet, fuel transport volumes could serve as a reliable anchor to justify broader railway investments and revitalise national rail systems that support multi-sector logistics.”

In West and Southern Africa, a new wave of refining projects, if backed by effective policy frameworks and blended finance models can reduce import dependency and foster cleaner, domestic fuel production.

The report also stressed the importance of resilient, future-ready infrastructure to accommodate Africa’s eventual transition to cleaner energy sources, while still meeting near-term petroleum needs.

title: Das Treueprogramm von Air France und KLM wird 20 | airportzentrale.de
description:
Flying Blue, das Treueprogramm von Air France und KLM feiert 2025 seinen 20.
2005 wurde es ins Leben gerufen, als die Treueprogramme Fréquence Plus von Air France und Flying Dutchman von KLM zusammengelegt wurden.
Anfangs bestand Flying Blue aus Air France, KLM und Aircalin.
Dieses Jahr wird neben dem neuen Flying Blue Extra-Abonnement auch die mobile App Flying Blue+ in den Vereinigten Staaten und in Großbritannien eingeführt.
Flying Blue Meilensteine 2005–2010: Einführung und Konsolidierung 2005: Einführung von Flying Blue für Air France und KLM sowie Aircalin nach dem Zusammenschluss der Treueprogramme Fréquence Plus von Air France und Flying Dutchman von KLM.
text:
Flying Blue, das Treueprogramm von Air France und KLM feiert 2025 seinen 20. Geburtstag. 2005 wurde es ins Leben gerufen, als die Treueprogramme Fréquence Plus von Air France und Flying Dutchman von KLM zusammengelegt wurden. Ziel war es, die besondere Beziehung und Verbindung der Reisenden zu den Fluggesellschaften der neuen Gruppe aufrechtzuerhalten und den Mitgliedern zu ermöglichen, ihrem Traumreiseerlebnis immer näher zu kommen.

Anfangs bestand Flying Blue aus Air France, KLM und Aircalin. 2010 schloss sich Tarom dem Programm an und 2013 folgte Transavia. Heute zählt das globale Treueprogramm fast 30 Millionen Mitglieder, nahezu 40 Partnerfluggesellschaften sowie mehr als 100 internationale und lokale Händler, bei denen Kunden Meilen sammeln und einlösen können.

Flying Blue wird regelmäßig als eines der besten Treueprogramme in Europa anerkannt. Der Reiseexperte Point.me hat es kürzlich zum „besten Airline Rewards-Programm der Welt“ gekürt, da es in nahezu allen wichtigen Kriterien, von der Großzügigkeit über die Qualität des Kundenservice bis zur Benutzerfreundlichkeit, Spitzenleistungen erzielt. Diese Auszeichnung spiegelt die Fähigkeit von Flying Blue wider, das Reiseerlebnis für seine Mitglieder zu verbessern und sich durch die Weiterentwicklung des Programms und seiner Dienstleistungen im Laufe der Jahre erfolgreich an sich ändernde Lebensgewohnheiten und Wünsche anzupassen.

Zu den wegweisenden Innovationen zählen u.a. die Einführung der neuen Ultimate-Stufe 2017 als Anerkennung für die Mitglieder mit einem sehr hohen Reisevolumen bei Air France und KLM, die Cash & Miles-Funktion, mit der Kunden verschiedene Zahlungsmethoden kombinieren können, und der Flying Blue Shop for Miles, mit dem Mitglieder seit 2018 bei ihren Online-Einkäufen bei einer Vielzahl von Partnern Meilen sammeln können.

Flying Blue entwickelt sich ständig weiter. 2022 wurde Flying Blue Family eingeführt, mit dem Reisende Meilen mit bis zu sieben Familienmitgliedern teilen können. 2023 und 2024 kamen Amazon und Uber zu der langen Liste der Partner hinzu, und 2023 präsentierte Flying Blue ein neues Logo. Dieses Jahr wird neben dem neuen Flying Blue Extra-Abonnement auch die mobile App Flying Blue+ in den Vereinigten Staaten und in Großbritannien eingeführt.

Zu guter Letzt bietet Flying Blue seinen Mitgliedern die Möglichkeit, ihre Großzügigkeit unter Beweis zu stellen, indem sie ihre Meilen nicht nur für Beiträge zu alternativen Treibstoffen (SAF – Sustainable Aviation Fuel) einsetzen, sondern auch an NGOs und Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen spenden können. Im vergangenen Jahr spendeten die Mitglieder insgesamt 450 Millionen Meilen.

Heute können Mitglieder des Flying Blue-Programms auf der Grundlage der im Laufe des Jahres gesammelten Erfahrungspunkte (XP) einen von fünf Status erreichen: Explorer, Silver, Gold, Platinum und Ultimate, die ihnen verschiedene Vorteile bieten, von bevorzugtem Check-in und personalisierten Concierge-Services bis zu zusätzlichem Freigepäck, Zugang zu Flughafen-Lounges und Upgrades.

Anlässlich des 20. Geburtstags und als emotionale Hommage an ihre Mitglieder hat Fyling Blue eine neue, weltweite Kampagne mit dem Titel „Turning Miles into Memories, for 20 years“ (Meilen in Erinnerungen verwandeln, seit 20 Jahren) gestartet.

Flying Blue Meilensteine

2005–2010: Einführung und Konsolidierung

2005: Einführung von Flying Blue für Air France und KLM sowie Aircalin nach dem Zusammenschluss der Treueprogramme Fréquence Plus von Air France und Flying Dutchman von KLM.

2007: Flying Blue wird zum Treueprogramm von Kenya Airways.

2009: Einführung neuer Elite-Mitgliedschaftsstufen (Silver, Gold, Platinum) mit exklusiven Vorteilen.

2010: Flying Blue wird zum Treueprogramm von Tarom.

2010: Flying Blue wird bei den Frequent Traveler Awards zum „Besten Elite-Programm“ (Europa/Afrika) gewählt.

2010: Einführung der Air France-KLM/Flying Blue AMEX-Karten.

2011–2015: Expansion und Partnerschaften

Aufnahme neuer Partnerfluggesellschaften und Nicht-Fluggesellschaften, um Mitgliedern mehr Möglichkeiten zum Sammeln und Einlösen von Meilen zu bieten.

2013: Flying Blue wird zum Treueprogramm von Transavia.

2013: Flying Blue wird von den Global Traveler Awards zum „Besten Vielfliegerprogramm“ gewählt.

2016–2020: Innovation und Personalisierung

2016: Einführung von Miles-Upgrade, so dass Mitglieder ihre Meilen in Upgrades umwandeln können.

2016: Flying Blue wird von den Business Traveler Awards zum „Besten Vielfliegerprogramm“ (Europa) gewählt.

2017: Einführung von Flying Blue Ultimate.

2018: Einführung von XP zur Optimierung der Verwaltung von Statusstufen durch Ersetzen des Meilen-Status.

2018: Die Stufe „Ivory“ wird zu „Explorer“.

2018: Einführung von Cash & Miles und Flying Blue Shop for Miles.

2019: Einführung der Miles + Points-Partnerschaft mit ALL/Accor.

2021–2025: Digitalisierung und neue Dienstleistungen

2022: Option, mit Meilen, SAF zu kaufen.

2022: Einführung von Flying Blue Family.

2023: Neues Markenimage.

2024: Flying Blue von Point.me zum „Besten Airline Rewards-Programm der Welt“ gewählt.

2025: Einführung der Flying Blue+ Mobile App in den Vereinigten Staaten und in Großbritannien.

2025: Einführung des Flying Blue Extra-Abonnementpakets.

Quelle: PM Air France

title: Così anche il motore diesel può essere più sostenibile - Il Messaggero
description:
Sì , grazie ai biocarburanti HVO in purezza anche un'auto con motore diesel può essere più sostenibile.
Entrambi i siti industriali sono alimentati prevalentemente da materie prime di scarto e da residui.
La decarbonizzazione del settore dei trasporti può essere raggiunta con successo se si utilizzano, secondo il principio della neutralità tecnologica, tutte le soluzioni e i vettori energetici disponibili.
E tra questi vettori, i biocarburanti Hvo hanno un ruolo fondamentale perché possono dare un contributo immediato alla riduzione delle emissioni, calcolate lungo l’intera catena del valore, del settore dei trasporti.
Grazie alla tecnologia proprietaria Ecofining, Eni dal 2014 produce un biocarburante da materie prime rinnovabili che può essere utilizzato in purezza nei motori diesel compatibili.
text:
Sì , grazie ai biocarburanti HVO in purezza anche un'auto con motore diesel può essere più sostenibile. Parte da questa premessa Enilive, la società che per prima in Italia ha puntato sul biocarburante HVO, prodotto da materie prime al 100% rinnovabili e compatibile con gli attuali motori a gasolio. In Italia il combustibile, capace di tagliare dal 60 al 90% delle emissioni di gas serra (calcolare lungo tutto il ciclo di vita, rispetto al mix fossile di riferimento), viene prodotto nelle bioraffinerie di Enilive di Porto Marghera e Gela. Entrambi i siti industriali sono alimentati prevalentemente da materie prime di scarto e da residui.

La decarbonizzazione del settore dei trasporti può essere raggiunta con successo se si utilizzano, secondo il principio della neutralità tecnologica, tutte le soluzioni e i vettori energetici disponibili. E tra questi vettori, i biocarburanti Hvo hanno un ruolo fondamentale perché possono dare un contributo immediato alla riduzione delle emissioni, calcolate lungo l’intera catena del valore, del settore dei trasporti. Non solo su strada, ma anche per il trasporto aereo, marittimo e ferroviario. Grazie alla tecnologia proprietaria Ecofining, Eni dal 2014 produce un biocarburante da materie prime rinnovabili che può essere utilizzato in purezza nei motori diesel compatibili. Si chiama HVOlution: questo particolare combustibile oggi è disponibile in oltre 1.300 stazioni della rete Enilive in Europa.

A livello globale, le stime prevedono che la domanda di biocarburanti idrogenati aumenterà del 65% tra il 2024 e il 2028. Nel frattempo, la maggior parte degli Stati membri dell'Ue ha già stabilito aumenti annuali degli obiettivi di miscelazione dei biocarburanti a partire dal 2024, come parte degli obblighi previsti dalle direttive RED e, a partire dal 2025, dal ReFuelEU per il settore dell'aviazione. A gennaio di quest'anno Enilive ha annunciato l’avvio del primo impianto dedicato alla produzione di SAF (Sustainable Aviation Fuel) nella bioraffineria di Gela, in Sicilia. Il SAF prodotto contiene il 100% di componente biogenica ed è idoneo a essere utilizzato in miscela con il jet fuel convenzionale fino al 50%. L’impianto di Gela ha una capacità produttiva di 400mila tonnellate l'anno, pari a quasi un terzo della domanda di SAF prevista in Europa nel 2025.

La controllata del Cane a sei zampe negli ultimi tre anni ha stretto accordi con diverse compagnie aeree per la fornitura di SAF, grazie alle prime produzioni realizzate in sinergia tra la bioraffineria Enilive di Gela e altri impianti Eni a partire da materie prime di scarto. Più nel dettaglio, il Regolamento UE 2023/2405 impone ai fornitori di carburante per l’aviazione di garantire che il jet fuel messo a disposizione degli operatori aerei in ogni aeroporto dell’Unione Europea contenga quote di SAF. L’immissione sul mercato di SAF deve avvenire in quantità crescenti. Quest'anno si parte da una quota minima del 2%. Previsto un incremento della quota ogni cinque anni: 6% dal 2030, 20% dal 2035, 34% dal 2040 e 42% dal 2045. L'obiettivo è di raggiungere il 70% dal 2050.

text:
Bio-Aviation Fuel Market Provides Detailed Segmentation of this Market based on Type, Application, and Region and Forecast for the Period from 2025 - 2032

Bio-Aviation Fuel Market Analysis and Latest Trends

Bio-aviation fuel, derived from renewable biological resources, serves as a sustainable alternative to conventional jet fuel. It aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and reliance on fossil fuels in the aviation sector. The growing emphasis on environmental sustainability and regulatory measures targeting carbon footprints are driving the adoption of bio-aviation fuels globally.

Market growth analysis indicates a robust expansion within the bio-aviation fuel sector, spurred by increasing demand for cleaner fuels and advancements in production technologies. As airlines prioritize sustainable practices to meet emissions targets, investments in biofuel production and partnerships with research institutions are on the rise.

Notably, the Bio-Aviation Fuel Market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 7% during the forecast period. Recent trends include a greater focus on feedstock innovation, such as the use of agricultural residues and algae, which enhances the sustainability and cost-effectiveness of biofuels. Additionally, government incentives and collaborations between stakeholders are facilitating infrastructure development for biofuel production and distribution, ultimately supporting the transition toward greener aviation practices. As consumer awareness and demand for sustainable travel options grow, the bio-aviation fuel market is poised for significant growth in the coming years.

Bio-Aviation Fuel Major Market Players

The bio-aviation fuel market is gaining momentum due to increasing environmental regulations and the aviation industry's push toward sustainability. Key players include Neste, Total/Amyris, Fulcrum, Gevo, Red Rock Biofuels, SG Preston, Velocys, LanzaTech, SkyNRG, and Sinopec.

Neste, a pioneer in renewable fuel production, is among the largest producers of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), focusing on expanding its European and North American operations. In recent years, Neste's revenue reached approximately €3.1 billion, driven by strong demand for renewable products, with an expectation to double their SAF production capacity by 2026.

Total/Amyris combines traditional oil and biotechnology innovations to produce SAF from renewable feedstocks. They have seen investments grow, with Total's revenue from renewable products expected to contribute significantly to their overall portfolio as they aim to produce around 1.5 million tons of SAF by 2030.

Fulcrum BioEnergy specializes in converting municipal solid waste to jet fuel, positioning itself to tap into the growing waste-to-fuel market. While still scaling operations, Fulcrum's strategic partnerships are expected to drive revenue growth significantly in the coming years.

Gevo focuses on producing SAF from renewable resources, boasting a targeted production capacity of up to 1 billion gallons per year by 2025. Their revenue has shown growth potential, recently reporting figures around $1.2 million, with further increases anticipated as production ramps up.

Overall, the bio-aviation fuel market is poised for substantial growth, with projections estimating a market size of $15 billion by 2030, driven by stakeholder investments and regulatory support for sustainable aviation solutions.

What Are The Key Opportunities For Bio-Aviation Fuel Manufacturers?

The bio-aviation fuel market, projected to reach approximately $28 billion by 2030, is experiencing significant growth driven by stringent regulations on greenhouse gas emissions and increasing adoption of sustainable aviation practices. Key growth factors include advancements in fuel production technologies, rising investments from major airlines, and government incentives. The growing awareness of climate change and a shift towards renewable sources are further propelling demand. Regions such as North America and Europe lead the market, while Asia Pacific shows rapid growth potential. Future outlook indicates robust expansion, fueled by innovation and collaboration across the aviation supply chain.

title: Sky High Impact: How Sustainable Aviation is Transforming Corporate Travel Policies for a ...
description:
Welcome to the era of sustainable aviation in corporate travel—a future shaped by science-based carbon targets, responsible travel policies, and innovative low-emission fuels.
This essay dives deep into how companies are building smarter, greener corporate travel systems—with carbon management as their compass.
From Policies to Practice: Greening Corporate Travel Forward-thinking companies are embedding sustainability into their travel policies with real operational consequences.
Aviation and ESG Strategy Alignment As ESG disclosures evolve from voluntary to mandatory, corporate aviation policies are now considered ESG material.
Final Thoughts: From Altitude to Accountability The future of corporate aviation is not flightless—it is flawless in impact, intentional in strategy, and aligned with a regenerative economy.
text:
Aviation is responsible for nearly 2.5% of global CO₂ emissions, yet it remains a cornerstone of global business. For corporations—especially multinationals in banking, retail, energy, and pharma—air travel is a necessity. But necessity must now be tempered with responsibility.

The question is no longer whether companies should address their aviation footprint. The question is how fast they can transform it.

Welcome to the era of sustainable aviation in corporate travel—a future shaped by science-based carbon targets, responsible travel policies, and innovative low-emission fuels. At McBride Corp México, we’ve worked alongside clients across sectors to reimagine executive mobility, logistics, and carbon strategies in line with emerging aviation sustainability standards.

This essay dives deep into how companies are building smarter, greener corporate travel systems—with carbon management as their compass.

The Business Travel Dilemma

Business air travel has long been a paradox for sustainability-conscious companies. On one hand, it fuels growth, connects global teams, and strengthens client relationships. On the other, each long-haul flight emits roughly 1 to 3 metric tons of CO₂ per passenger—the equivalent of driving a car for months.

As global sustainability frameworks like Science-Based Targets Initiative (SBTi) and Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD) become standard, corporate travel is being reevaluated through a climate lens.

Organizations that once set broad reduction goals are now setting granular KPIs: CO₂ per passenger-kilometer, sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) uptake percentage, and offset integrity ratings.

From Policies to Practice: Greening Corporate Travel

Forward-thinking companies are embedding sustainability into their travel policies with real operational consequences. Common elements include:

Internal carbon pricing: Assigning a cost per ton of CO₂ to flights, influencing booking decisions.

Air-travel approval thresholds: Only flights above a certain carbon intensity or destination tier require senior approval.

Travel-free alternatives: Encouraging remote collaboration tools or regional hubs to replace non-essential flights.

Green vendor contracts: Partnering only with airlines that disclose SAF usage, carbon metrics, and net-zero commitments.

By 2026, many listed companies in the EU and North America will need to disclose such travel metrics as part of ESG reporting frameworks.

At McBride, our Carbon Management service helps clients map, measure, and optimize these changes with real-time dashboards and custom offset portfolios.

The Rise of Carbon Offsets in Aviation

Until alternative fuels become ubiquitous, carbon offsets remain the most widely used tool to address aviation emissions. But the conversation has matured. No longer are generic tree-planting schemes sufficient.

Leading firms now demand high-integrity, third-party verified carbon credits with co-benefits such as biodiversity preservation, indigenous community support, or water restoration.

Examples of next-gen aviation offsets include:

Blue carbon projects: Protecting mangroves and coastal ecosystems.

Biochar initiatives: Locking carbon in agricultural soil.

Tech-based removal: Direct air capture (DAC) and mineralization.

Yet offsets must not be seen as a guilt-free license to pollute. McBride advises clients to adopt a "Reduce First, Offset Strategically" policy, ensuring that emissions cuts are the priority.

Alternative Fuels: The Promise and the Barriers

If aviation has a future, it’s written in SAF—Sustainable Aviation Fuel. Produced from waste oils, agricultural residues, or even captured CO₂, SAF can cut lifecycle emissions by up to 80% compared to fossil jet fuel, according to the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO).

SAF uptake is rising, with companies like Microsoft, Google, and DHL partnering with carriers to co-invest in fuel procurement. Still, SAF accounts for less than 1% of global aviation fuel, largely due to:

High cost (2–5x conventional jet fuel)

Limited supply and infrastructure

Regulatory complexity

To support adoption, McBride integrates SAF tracking modules within carbon inventories, helping clients both claim reductions and validate airline emissions disclosures.

We also facilitate group-buying consortia among clients, increasing SAF access and negotiating power across sectors.

Reimagining Executive Mobility

Sustainable aviation isn’t just about what you fly—it’s about whether you fly at all.

Innovative firms are building "Virtual First" mobility cultures, where physical travel is a last resort. They use:

Digital twins of global facilities for remote inspections

Holographic meetings and metaverse training

Carbon-based travel budgets by department

Some are also exploring flight class emission accounting—with economy seats emitting half the CO₂ of business class—and applying this to travel policy design.

The cultural shift is profound, and McBride supports clients in change management, internal communications, and aligning HR, finance, and sustainability teams around new norms.

The Role of Carbon Management in Sustainable Aviation

Every transformation needs a system. McBride’s Carbon Management framework integrates aviation sustainability with broader ESG goals through:

Corporate GHG inventory (Scopes 1, 2, and 3 air travel emissions)

Vendor benchmarking for airline sustainability claims

Science-based target alignment (SBTi and Net-Zero Standard)

Dynamic offset allocation with integrated SAF purchases

Annual reporting dashboards tailored to ISSB, CDP, and GRI

In our projects with firms in logistics, pharma, and IT, we’ve seen how embedding these tools unlocks data-driven decision making, cost efficiencies, and investor confidence.

Aviation and ESG Strategy Alignment

As ESG disclosures evolve from voluntary to mandatory, corporate aviation policies are now considered ESG material. Investors, insurers, and regulators look closely at how companies:

Disclose Scope 3 air travel emissions

Set science-aligned reduction targets

Demonstrate credible offsetting

Reduce absolute flight volumes year-over-year

A sustainable aviation program isn’t a siloed initiative—it’s an anchor for ESG leadership.

McBride embeds these principles into corporate ESG strategy, enabling clients to align with EU Taxonomy, CSRD, and other regulatory frameworks while reinforcing their corporate values.

Latin America: Strategic Leverage for Aviation Sustainability

While much of the SAF production and regulatory momentum is centered in Europe and North America, Latin America presents unique opportunities for aviation decarbonization:

Abundant bio-feedstocks for SAF (e.g., sugarcane bagasse, palm waste)

Untapped blue carbon projects in mangrove-rich coasts

Strong public-private interest in green aviation infrastructure

McBride has worked across Colombia, Mexico, Peru, and Brazil to help clients build climate-aligned aviation supply chains, negotiate SAF sourcing, and align airport operations with circular economy principles.

The Road Ahead: Innovations in the Aviation Ecosystem

Emerging technologies may soon redefine corporate air travel:

Hydrogen-powered aircraft under development by Airbus and startups

Electric short-haul flights for regional commutes

Autonomous eVTOLs (electric air taxis) reducing urban flight emissions

While these are years from commercialization, forward-looking companies are scenario-planning today.

McBride provides strategic foresight analysis to help organizations prepare for technological shifts, policy reforms, and evolving stakeholder expectations.

Final Thoughts: From Altitude to Accountability

The future of corporate aviation is not flightless—it is flawless in impact, intentional in strategy, and aligned with a regenerative economy.

In an era where every ton of carbon counts, your organization’s flight decisions signal your true ESG priorities. Sustainable aviation isn’t just about fuel—it’s about future-proofing your brand, your compliance, and your leadership.

At McBride Corp México, we invite you to partner with us to build a climate-positive aviation model for your business—one that takes your ambitions sky high, without bringing the planet down.

📚 Further Reading

title: XCF Global and Focus Impact BH3 Acquisition Company announce closing of Business Combination
description:
XCF Global Capital, Inc. (XCF Global), a key player in decarbonizing the aviation industry through Synthetic Aviation Fuel (SAF), today announced the successful completion of its business combination with Focus Impact BH3 Acquisition Company (OTC PINK:BHAC) (Focus Impact BH3), a special purpose acquisition company.
The combined company will operate under the name XCF Global, Inc. and its Class A common stock is expected to commence trading on the Nasdaq Capital Market (Nasdaq) under the ticker symbol “SAFX” on June 9, 2025.
“The completion of this transaction marks a transformational step for XCF Global and the decarbonization of the aviation industry,” said Mihir Dange, Chief Executive Officer of XCF Global.
“With commercial production underway, first deliveries completed, and a proven business model in place, we are entering the public markets with momentum and a clear path to growth.
XCF Global is positioned as a market leader at the intersection of aviation and decarbonization – standing at the forefront of a high-growth opportunity in synthetic aviation fuel.
text:
XCF Global Capital, Inc. (XCF Global), a key player in decarbonizing the aviation industry through Synthetic Aviation Fuel (SAF), today announced the successful completion of its business combination with Focus Impact BH3 Acquisition Company (OTC PINK:BHAC) (Focus Impact BH3), a special purpose acquisition company.

The combined company will operate under the name XCF Global, Inc. and its Class A common stock is expected to commence trading on the Nasdaq Capital Market (Nasdaq) under the ticker symbol “SAFX” on June 9, 2025.

“The completion of this transaction marks a transformational step for XCF Global and the decarbonization of the aviation industry,” said Mihir Dange, Chief Executive Officer of XCF Global. “With commercial production underway, first deliveries completed, and a proven business model in place, we are entering the public markets with momentum and a clear path to growth. XCF Global is positioned as a market leader at the intersection of aviation and decarbonization – standing at the forefront of a high-growth opportunity in synthetic aviation fuel. We offer the public capital markets access to one of the fastest-growing sectors in the global energy transition, and we are proud to be leading the shift toward a lower-carbon future for aviation.”

“We are thrilled to have completed the Business Combination with XCF Global and bring this transformative SAF platform to the public markets,” said Carl Stanton, CEO of Focus Impact BH3. “With strong macro tailwinds, a repeatable site development model, and a world-class management team, XCF Global is uniquely positioned to scale SAF production and drive meaningful impact in the energy transition while creating long-term value for shareholders.”

Highlights

XCF Global’s New Rise Reno facility began commercial production of neat SAF in February 2025, with a nameplate production capacity of 38 million gallons of neat SAF per year

First customer deliveries of neat SAF completed in March 2025, marking a major operational milestone

Advancing a pipeline of production sites in Nevada, North Carolina, and Florida to expand SAF capacity and support long-term growth
